translated: In order to clarify the vajra words that abide there, the Continuation Tantra, the chapter on the single speech of all tathagatas, was taught. In order to make an opportunity for the bodhisattvas to request that, the Bhagavan Vajradhara said thus and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba ni sgrib pa med cing dag pa nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba ni sgrib pa med cing dag pa nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consecration of all the Tathagatas is the nature of the realm of space, which is pure and free from obscurations.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: And that is the Blessed One, the Lord of the Mandala, Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'o ;
translated: His body, speech, and mind are the secrets.

original: / de rnams kyi bstan pa ni bshad pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: / de rnams kyi bstan pa ni bshad pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Their teaching is the form of explanation.

original: dngos po thams cad de ma lus pa'o //üîΩde dus ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing thos la khong du chud nas zhes bya ba la dus de gzugs su bstan pa'i dus su mthong la /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad de ma lus pa'o // de dus ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing thos la khong du chud nas zhes bya ba la dus de gzugs su bstan pa'i dus su mthong la /
translated: All things are all without exception.üîΩHaving seen, heard, and understood them just as they are, at the proper time,

original: gsung du bshad pa'i dus su thos shing phyis khong du chud pa de mngon sum du byas nas so //
analyzed: gsung du bshad pa'i dus su thos shing phyis khong du chud pa de mngon sum du byas nas so //
translated: having seen them at the time of their manifestation in form, having heard them at the time of their explanation in speech, and having understood them later, he actualized them.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: Just as they are means without error.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gang gis bstan pa 'di gsan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gang gis bstan pa 'di gsan pa'o //
translated: They means those who have heard this teaching.

original: gzigs pa ni nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Vision is the direct realization of all phenomena by oneself.

original: de dag gis tha snyad du mdzad pa'i phyir chos gzigs @86b pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis tha snyad du mdzad pa'i phyir chos gzigs @86b pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the vision of phenomena because he makes conventional designations.

original: gsol to zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gsol to zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'o //
translated: He asked means he requested.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar gyi sgo nas dri ba zhus pa'o //üîΩkun du bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang ba ste de ni sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar gyi sgo nas dri ba zhus pa'o // kun du bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang ba ste de ni sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: Ah! is a question asked in amazement.

original: de rnams kyi nges pa dag ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid de de ngo mtshar yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nges pa dag ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid de de ngo mtshar yin no //
translated: Samantabhadra is Vajradhara, and his body, speech, and mind are the reality to be known, which is amazing.

original: ji ltar ngo mtshar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo mtshar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it amazing?

original: kun du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
translated: Everywhere means in all world systems.

original: gang de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dag gis rnam par bzhugs so //
analyzed: gang de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dag gis rnam par bzhugs so //
translated: He abides with his body, speech, and mind.

original: gang la bzhugs she na /
analyzed: gang la bzhugs she na /
translated: Where does he abide?

original: sems can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la'o //
translated: In all sentient beings.

original: ci kho bo cag dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci kho bo cag dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: Are we the same as him?

original: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni dus gsum gyi rdo rje'i ngo bor yang dag byung ngo //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni dus gsum gyi rdo rje'i ngo bor yang dag byung ngo //
translated: The statement ‚Äúnot so‚Äù is in reference to the essence of the three times‚Äô vajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba gsum ni dus gsum yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba gsum ni dus gsum yin la /
translated: The three secrets of all tathƒÅgatas are the three times.

original: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni ro gcig par snang ba'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi sems shin tu rnam par dag pa de nyid ngo bor te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni ro gcig par snang ba'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi sems shin tu rnam par dag pa de nyid ngo bor te /
translated: The vajra of those is the essence of the mind of enlightenment, which is the nature of appearing as one taste, and that is the very pure.

original: rang gi rang bzhin der yang yang dag par byung ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin der yang yang dag par byung ba ste /
translated: It is also the essence of that, which has arisen from that,

original: de rnams kyi sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the obscurations of those have been abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang gi gnas chos kyi sku thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang gi gnas chos kyi sku thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the vajra enlightenment is the attainment of the dharmakƒÅya, the state of Vajradhara.

original: de nyid kyi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rdo rje yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rdo rje yang de dag yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are also the vajra buddhas, because of their inexhaustibility by way of the enjoyment body.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas de dang der bltams pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po yin pas na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas de dang der bltams pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po yin pas na /
translated: Since he is a great wonder by virtue of his emanation body, he is born here and there and passes into final nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje rdzu 'phrul che'o //
translated: The Buddha is the great wonder, the vajra.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe sku thams cad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas nyid kyi sgo nas ngo mtshar te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe sku thams cad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas nyid kyi sgo nas ngo mtshar te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This much is said in order to show the wonder of all the buddhas in all their bodies at all times in all their abodes.

original: yang khyad par lngas ngo mtshar du bstan pa'i phyir ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang khyad par lngas ngo mtshar du bstan pa'i phyir ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In order to show the wonder by means of five distinctions, he says, ‚ÄúAh!

original: 'dir rab ngo mtshar che zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: 'dir rab ngo mtshar che zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthe highest wonder‚Äù is the distinction of magnitude.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù is the distinction of freedom from conceptual elaboration.

original: dbang po 'das zhes bya ba ni zab pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: dbang po 'das zhes bya ba ni zab pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBeyond the senses‚Äù is the distinction of profundity.

original: mchog tu mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i khyad par gyis te /
analyzed: mchog tu mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i khyad par gyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù is the distinction of abandonment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the obscurations of the afflictive emotions are completely abandoned.

original: 'khor ba dag gi rgyun zhes bya ba ni sku rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag gi rgyun zhes bya ba ni sku rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: The continuity of cyclic existence is due to the distinction of the permanence of the body.

original: de de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa ni lan te nges par gzung bas the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa ni lan te nges par gzung bas the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reply it is so is the ascertainment, because it cuts off doubt.

original: phyi ma'i phyi ma zhes bya ba ni mchog @87a * //üîΩlas kyang mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i phyi ma zhes bya ba ni mchog @87a * // las kyang mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The later later is the supreme of the supreme.

original: yang dag gsung bas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang gis so //
analyzed: yang dag gsung bas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang gis so //
translated: The true speech is of Vajradhara.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud de //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud de //
translated: The that is the root tantra.

original: de la sbas pa'i gnas gang yin pa de rnams rtogs pa nyid ni don de bya ba nyid yin pas na don de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbas pa'i gnas gang yin pa de rnams rtogs pa nyid ni don de bya ba nyid yin pas na don de'i phyir ro //
translated: The hidden places are those that are realized, because they are the very meaning to be accomplished. Therefore, it is for that meaning.

original: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed rnams la'o //
analyzed: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed rnams la'o //
translated: The you is for you all.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: The good, good is the encouragement.

original: sems dpa' che zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa chen po ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' che zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa chen po ste /
translated: The great being is the great intention.

original: sems can rnams kyi don chen po bya ba'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don chen po bya ba'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the intention of performing great benefit for sentient beings.

original: gsang ba rnams thos pa dang 'dzin pa dang ston pa la mkhas pa dang ldan pas na yon tan gyi gnas so //
analyzed: gsang ba rnams thos pa dang 'dzin pa dang ston pa la mkhas pa dang ldan pas na yon tan gyi gnas so //
translated: They are a basis of qualities because they are endowed with skill in hearing, retaining, and teaching the secret.

original: som nyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom can gyi don to //
analyzed: som nyi zhes bya ba ni the tshom can gyi don to //
translated: Doubt means a matter of uncertainty.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyud la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyud la'o //
translated: Here means in the tantra.

original: gsang ba la sogs pa'i sgra rang gi ngo bo tsam du bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa can yin mod kyi zhes bya ba brjod pa'i phyir 'brel pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang ba la sogs pa'i sgra rang gi ngo bo tsam du bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa can yin mod kyi zhes bya ba brjod pa'i phyir 'brel pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although the words secret and so on are taught merely in terms of their own nature, the word obtained is stated in order to express that they are not unrelated.

original: dper na 'di ba lang zhes smras so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na 'di ba lang zhes smras so zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying this is a cow.

original: 'di'i sgra zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rnam par dbye ba'i tshig can 'di thams cad kyi don la 'jug pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di'i sgra zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rnam par dbye ba'i tshig can 'di thams cad kyi don la 'jug pa yin no /
translated: The word this has the meaning of that. This word is used for the meaning of all of this which has the word distinction.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud yin te /
translated: This is the Yoga Tantra called the Guhyasamaja.

original: de rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it expresses that.

original: 'brel pa med pa ni rjod par byed par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa ni rjod par byed par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that something unrelated becomes the expression,

original: se'u 'bru bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag lta bu'o //
analyzed: se'u 'bru bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag lta bu'o //
translated: like the sentence ‚Äúten pomegranates.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dri ba lnga zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni dri ba lnga zhus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the first verse is the request for the five questions.

original: rnal 'byor dang rgyud ni rgyud dang rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rgyud ni rgyud dang rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Yoga and Tantra are Tantra and Yoga.

original: de dag ci la bgyi zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gnyis so ;
analyzed: de dag ci la bgyi zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gnyis so ;
translated: What is to be done with them?

original: / gang du rnal 'byor zhes 'dir ci la bgyi zhes pa'i tshig 'byung ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / gang du rnal 'byor zhes 'dir ci la bgyi zhes pa'i tshig 'byung ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for the word ‚Äúwhat‚Äù to occur here in ‚Äúwhat is yoga?‚Äù

original: de bzhin rigs zhes 'dir ci lags zhes pa la de bzhin gyi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin rigs zhes 'dir ci lags zhes pa la de bzhin gyi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i don to //
translated: In ‚Äúwhat is the lineage here?‚Äù the word ‚Äúhere‚Äù has the sense of inclusion.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa thugs la gzhag pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa thugs la gzhag pa ste ;
translated: Here means the verse of inclusion that is kept in mind.

original: rigs la sogs pa'i sgras ci zhig brjod ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub chen po yang de yin la /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i sgras ci zhig brjod ces bya ba'i don to // byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub chen po yang de yin la /
translated: What is meant by the words ‚Äúfamily‚Äù and so on?

original: dam tshig nyid yin pa'i phyir sems dpa' yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig nyid yin pa'i phyir sems dpa' yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat Bodhisattva‚Äù means that it is great enlightenment because it is reality, and it is a bodhisattva because it is a vow.

original: rab bskul ba zhes bya ba ni @87b gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab bskul ba zhes bya ba ni @87b gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUrged‚Äù means requested.

original: bzhag nas zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bzhag nas zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving placed‚Äù means how?

original: de'i sbyor bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the application of that.

original: zhus pa rgya chen zhes bya ba ni zhus pa rgyas pa'i yul can gyi don rnams so //
analyzed: zhus pa rgya chen zhes bya ba ni zhus pa rgyas pa'i yul can gyi don rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúExtensive questions‚Äù means the objects of the extensive questions.

original: rang rang gi lus la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi lus la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should connect ‚Äúobserving the body, etc. of Great Vajradhara‚Äù with each one.

original: rang gi thugs la dmigs par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mdzad pas so //
analyzed: rang gi thugs la dmigs par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du mdzad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúObserving his own mind‚Äù means making it manifest.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis de la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis de la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having blessed means having applied to that by the special power.

original: gsung gcig gis ni dbyangs gcig gis so //
analyzed: gsung gcig gis ni dbyangs gcig gis so //
translated: With one voice means with one sound.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni re re'i sku dang sngags dang mtshan ma'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ram sangs rgyas dang rig pa dang khro bo'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni re re'i sku dang sngags dang mtshan ma'i bdag nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ram sangs rgyas dang rig pa dang khro bo'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three aspects are the nature of the body, mantra, and sign of each, or the nature of the Buddha, knowledge, and wrathful one.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas thams cad yod pas na sangs rgyas thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas thams cad yod pas na sangs rgyas thams cad do //
translated: It is of all the buddhas because all the buddhas are present here.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Guhyasamaja is Bhagavan Mahavajradhara.

original: de rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The tantra is called that because it expresses that.

original: de'i rjod par byed pa nyid kyang ngag gcig po nyid du 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa nyid kyang ngag gcig po nyid du 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That expression is also connected to the single voice.

original: 'brel pa de yang gsang ba 'dus pa don gcig nyid la bsdu ba'i phyir le'u thams cad phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang gsang ba 'dus pa don gcig nyid la bsdu ba'i phyir le'u thams cad phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that connection is for the sake of condensing the one reality of the Guhyasamaja, and so all the chapters mutually assist each other.

original: de la dang por rang gi dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhis 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir lnga pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das thabs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang por rang gi dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhis 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir lnga pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gsang ba 'dus pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das thabs las byung ba'o //
translated: Therein, first, in order to demonstrate the connection by way of his own authority, he declares the five and so forth, for this Guhyasamaja is the Bhagavat arisen from the means.

original: de'i thabs ni bzhi ste bsnyen pa dang nye bar sgrub pa dang sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni bzhi ste bsnyen pa dang nye bar sgrub pa dang sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The means are four, called the approach, the near attainment, the attainment, and the great attainment, which will be explained.

original: de la thabs las byung ba rdo rje 'chang nyid ni le'u dang por bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thabs las byung ba rdo rje 'chang nyid ni le'u dang por bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the Vajradhara arisen from the means is taught in the first chapter,

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the principal one.

original: de'i 'og tu le'u bcu drug gis ni thabs bzhi yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu le'u bcu drug gis ni thabs bzhi yin la /
translated: Then, the four means are in the sixteen chapters.

original: de nas bco brgyad pas ni gnyis ka gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas bco brgyad pas ni gnyis ka gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Then, the eighteenth clarifies both.

original: de bas na thabs las byung ba thabs dang bcas pa gsal bar byed pa dang bcas pa bsdus pa'i phyir ltos pa'i mtshan nyid can ni le'u rnams kyi 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thabs las byung ba thabs dang bcas pa gsal bar byed pa dang bcas pa bsdus pa'i phyir ltos pa'i mtshan nyid can ni le'u rnams kyi 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection of the chapters is characterized by dependence, because the arisen from means, together with means, together with illumination, and together with inclusion are included.

original: de la le'u thog ma tha ma dag ni ma gsungs kyang 'brel pa grub pa yin pa de ltar na le'u lhag ma rnams kyi 'brel pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa yin te /üîΩ'di ni 'di rnams kyis bsdus @88a * //
analyzed: de la le'u thog ma tha ma dag ni ma gsungs kyang 'brel pa grub pa yin pa de ltar na le'u lhag ma rnams kyi 'brel pa tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa yin te / 'di ni 'di rnams kyis bsdus @88a * //
translated: There, the connection of the first and last chapters is established even without being stated. Thus, the connection of the remaining chapters is stated in a verse:

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of their inclusion.

original: dga' ba can gyi le'us ni sgrub pa chen po dang rdzogs ldan gyi le'us ni sgrub pa dang / gnyis ldan gyi le'us ni nye bar sgrub pa dang / gsum ldan gyi le'us ni bsnyen pa ston to //
analyzed: dga' ba can gyi le'us ni sgrub pa chen po dang rdzogs ldan gyi le'us ni sgrub pa dang / gnyis ldan gyi le'us ni nye bar sgrub pa dang / gsum ldan gyi le'us ni bsnyen pa ston to //
translated: The chapter on the joyful one teaches the great practice, the chapter on the complete teaches the practice, the chapter on the two-part teaches the near practice, and the chapter on the three-part teaches the approach.

original: de la thabs bzhi po re re'i phyed phyi mas ni mtshan nyid dang / phyed snga mas ni le'u yin no //
analyzed: de la thabs bzhi po re re'i phyed phyi mas ni mtshan nyid dang / phyed snga mas ni le'u yin no //
translated: There, the latter half of each of the four means is the characteristic, and the former half is the chapter.

original: rgyas pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of extensive is as follows:

original: lnga pa dang ni dgu pa dang // bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: lnga pa dang ni dgu pa dang // bcu bdun pa dang bcu gsum pa //
translated: The fifth, the ninth, the seventeenth, and the thirteenth.

original: zhes bya ba le'u bzhi po de dag ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba le'u bzhi po de dag ni sgrub pa chen po ste /
translated: These four chapters are the great accomplishment.

original: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don yin zhing sgrub pa chen po'i bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don yin zhing sgrub pa chen po'i bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning of the great accomplishment is explained in the great accomplishment chapter.

original: thabs bzhi po so sor re re zhing mngon par rtogs pa dang dam tshig gnyis gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: thabs bzhi po so sor re re zhing mngon par rtogs pa dang dam tshig gnyis gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Each of the four methods is divided into two: the clear realization and the pledge.

original: mtshan nyid gnyi ga yang gcig gi nus pa tha dad kyi rigs pas ngag gcig gis ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyi ga yang gcig gi nus pa tha dad kyi rigs pas ngag gcig gis ston to //
translated: The definition of both is taught by a single statement through the reasoning of different capacities.

original: de las sgrub pa chen po'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de las sgrub pa chen po'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: From that, the definition of the great accomplishment is the teaching of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la rig pa'i skyes bu'i bdag pos yan lag dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyung ba ni sgrub pa chen po'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rig pa'i skyes bu'i bdag pos yan lag dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams phyung ba ni sgrub pa chen po'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The clear realization of the great accomplishment is the lord of knowledge beings extracting the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ma·πá·∏çala with its branches.

original: de yang ma lus par ni bcu bdun par ro //
analyzed: de yang ma lus par ni bcu bdun par ro //
translated: And that is all in the seventeenth chapter.

original: bcu gsum pa'i rig pa'i skyes bu'i nges par brtan ba las ni phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa'i rig pa'i skyes bu'i nges par brtan ba las ni phyogs gcig go //
translated: From the certainty of the knowledge of the person in the thirteenth chapter, it is one part.

original: dang bor yang thabs las byung ba'i zhor la phyogs gcig gis so //
analyzed: dang bor yang thabs las byung ba'i zhor la phyogs gcig gis so //
translated: And from the beginning, it is one part of the method of arising.

original: le'u lhag ma rnams su yang zhor la bstan to //
analyzed: le'u lhag ma rnams su yang zhor la bstan to //
translated: And it is taught incidentally in the remaining chapters.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam ni byang chub bo //
translated: The mere nondual intuition is enlightenment.

original: de rnyed pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de rnyed pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The attainment of that is buddhahood.

original: de la nges par bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de la nges par bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who is taught that.

original: de rnams kyi bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching is for their sake.

original: shin tu gsang ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúextremely secret conduct‚Äù is that.

original: dam tshig de yang sgrub pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dam tshig de yang sgrub pa chen po ste /
translated: And that commitment is the great practice,

original: thabs chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the great method.

original: de ni lnga pa dang dgu pa ma lus pas snyon pa bcu bdun pa la sogs pa'i phyir re res so //
analyzed: de ni lnga pa dang dgu pa ma lus pas snyon pa bcu bdun pa la sogs pa'i phyir re res so //
translated: That is all in the fifth and ninth chapters, and each is in the seventeenth chapter, etc.

original: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug pa //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang ni bcu drug pa //
translated: The fourth and the sixteenth,

original: brgyad pa bcu gnyis pa dag ni //
analyzed: brgyad pa bcu gnyis pa dag ni //
translated: the eighth and the twelfth,

original: sgrub pa ste 'di na gnas med pas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa ste 'di na gnas med pas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Since there is no abode here in the practice, the verse

original: bzhi pa'i mthar sgrub pa'i sdom pa zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i mthar sgrub pa'i sdom pa zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: is applied to the fourth stage, the vow of practice.

original: sgrub nyid gsang ba'i phyir sdom pa'i //
analyzed: sgrub nyid gsang ba'i phyir sdom pa'i //
translated: The vow is the practice itself, for the sake of secrecy.

original: slob dpon spyi yi las dang ni //
analyzed: slob dpon spyi yi las dang ni //
translated: The master's general duties,

original: dngos grub brtul zhugs sdom pa yin //
analyzed: dngos grub brtul zhugs sdom pa yin //
translated: and the vow of spiritual deportment for powers.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yin te de la 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyi rim pas dam tshig chen po'i @88b dkyil 'khor du ye shes sems dpa' la dbang bskur ba gsum sbyin pa ni slob dpon spyi'i las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yin te de la 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyi rim pas dam tshig chen po'i @88b dkyil 'khor du ye shes sems dpa' la dbang bskur ba gsum sbyin pa ni slob dpon spyi'i las so //
translated: This is the definition. Therein, the master's general duties are the bestowal of the three initiations in the mandala of the great commitment by means of the process of the method of great passion, in the initiation of the awareness deity.

original: rig pa'i skyes bu bskyed pa nas dbang bskur ba'i mthar thug pa ni dngos grub po //
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu bskyed pa nas dbang bskur ba'i mthar thug pa ni dngos grub po //
translated: The powers are from the creation of the awareness being up to the bestowal of the initiation.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
translated: The vow is the spiritual deportment of awareness.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa ni sngom pa sde /
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa ni sngom pa sde /
translated: The vow is the vow of worship, praise, and so forth.

original: sgrub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The clear realization of practice.

original: slob dpon gyi las thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs bzung ba dang / bsrung ba dang zin pa'i sdom pa rnams ni sgrub pa'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rig pa'i brtul zhugs bzung ba dang / bsrung ba dang zin pa'i sdom pa rnams ni sgrub pa'i dam tshig go //
translated: The pledges of practice are to know all the activities of the master and all the powers, to take up the conduct of awareness, and to maintain the pledges of protection and possession.

original: drug pa dang ni gnyis pa dang bcu pa dang bcu bzhi pa dag ni nye bar sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o ;üîΩ/ ni zhes bya bas mtshams sbyor ba'o //üîΩkha cig la ni drug pa 'dir //
analyzed: drug pa dang ni gnyis pa dang bcu pa dang bcu bzhi pa dag ni nye bar sgrub pa'i sdom pa'o ; / ni zhes bya bas mtshams sbyor ba'o // kha cig la ni drug pa 'dir //
translated: The pledges of near attainment are the sixth, second, tenth, and fourteenth of each half-month.üîΩThe word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the third line of the root stanza indicates that the pledges of attainment are the first, third, seventh, and eighth of each half-month.üîΩThe pledges of near attainment are the sixth, second, tenth, and fourteenth of each half-month.üîΩThe word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the third line of the root stanza indicates that the pledges of attainment are the first, third, seventh, and eighth of each half-month.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some texts read ‚Äúthe sixth here‚Äù instead of ‚Äúthe first here.‚Äù

original: 'dir zhes pa ni rgyud 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni rgyud 'dir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to this tantra.

original: drug pa zhes pa ni grangs drug par shes par byed pa'am gnas drug par shor bas na drug pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa zhes pa ni grangs drug par shes par byed pa'am gnas drug par shor bas na drug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSixth‚Äù means the sixth in the enumeration, or the sixth place.

original: nye ba'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni drug spyod dang rjes su chags pa'o//
analyzed: nye ba'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni drug spyod dang rjes su chags pa'o//
translated: The characteristics of the pledges of near attainment are enjoyment and passion.

original: de la rjes su chags pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni byin gyis rlobs pa'i sngags lnga ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni byin gyis rlobs pa'i sngags lnga ste /
translated: The clear realization of passion is the five mantras of blessing.

original: thugs me nyes par byed pas so //
analyzed: thugs me nyes par byed pas so //
translated: The mantra of the mind is:

original: drug shul gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni lnga pa rnams te zab cing phra ba'i dngos po la drag shul gyis yid 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug shul gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni lnga pa rnams te zab cing phra ba'i dngos po la drag shul gyis yid 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realization of the six-limbed [yoga] is the fifth, because it causes the mind to engage in the profound and subtle things with force.

original: dam tshig gi drag shul gyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi drag shul gyi spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct of the fierce practice of the commitments.

original: nye bar longs spyod pa'i spyod pa dang / dka' ba'i spyod pa ni lha rnams rjes su chags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod pa'i spyod pa dang / dka' ba'i spyod pa ni lha rnams rjes su chags par byed pa'o //
translated: The conduct of enjoyment and the conduct of hardship cause the deities to become attached.

original: de dag thams cad le'u bzhi po 'di rnams su ston to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad le'u bzhi po 'di rnams su ston to //
translated: All of these are taught in these four chapters.

original: bdun pa dang ni gsum pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bco lnga pa ste /
analyzed: bdun pa dang ni gsum pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bco lnga pa ste /
translated: The seventh, the third, the eleventh, and the fifteenth

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni bsnyen pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni bsnyen pa yin no //
translated: are the four [chapters] that are the service.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni dngos grub zhing dang mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid ni dngos grub zhing dang mtshan ma ste /
translated: The characteristics of this [service] are the field of attainment and the signs.

original: dngos grub ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: dngos grub ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Attainment is the yoga of the universal monarch.

original: zhing ni yan lag drug gi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhing ni yan lag drug gi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The field is the practice of the six-branched yoga,

original: de dag gis bdag nyid dngos grub mchog gi zhing du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bdag nyid dngos grub mchog gi zhing du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by those [six branches] one makes oneself into a field for the supreme attainment.

original: mtshan ma ni dam tshig dang rmi lam ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni dam tshig dang rmi lam ste /
translated: The signs are the commitments and dreams.

original: dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dngos grub ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dngos grub ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of spiritual powers, and because it reveals spiritual powers.

original: yang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
translated: Again, beginning with the benefit of others,

original: rgyud kyi 'grel pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las //
analyzed: rgyud kyi 'grel pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las //
translated: in order to demonstrate the commentary on the tantra in four verses,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, the activity of all the Tathagatas.

original: gzhan gyi don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The benefit of others is fourfold:

original: gzhug pa dang dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs su smin pa dang yongs su grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa dang dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs su smin pa dang yongs su grol ba'o //
translated: introduction, encouragement, maturation, and liberation.

original: @89a * // dbugs dbyung ba'i tshig ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: @89a * // dbugs dbyung ba'i tshig ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The encouragement is to be drawn out from within the second verse.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las /üîΩgzhan dag tshar gcod phan 'dogs spyod pa dag gang yin pa de ni rgyud 'di la dul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi las / gzhan dag tshar gcod phan 'dogs spyod pa dag gang yin pa de ni rgyud 'di la dul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi 'jug pa ste /
translated: The activity of all the Tathagatas

original: mngon par dad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dad pa'o //
translated: is the conduct of subjugating and benefiting others, which is the engagement of beings in this tantra, as declared in the line beginning with ‚Äútamed.üîΩ‚Äù

original: dul ba ni tshar gcod pa chung dus bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dul ba ni tshar gcod pa chung dus bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúTamed‚Äù is to be accomplished by a small subjugation.

original: gdul dka' ba ni tshar gcod pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba ni tshar gcod pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba rnams yin no //
translated: The difficult to tame are those to be accomplished by the great subjugation.

original: zhi ba ni phan gdags pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni phan gdags pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The peaceful are those to be accomplished by benefit.

original: mchog nyid ni dngos grub mchog dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni dngos grub mchog dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The supreme is that connected with the supreme power.

original: de la thun mong gi dngos grub dang 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la thun mong gi dngos grub dang 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection with the common power?

original: gang de'i bsnyen pa de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang de'i bsnyen pa de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is also fourfold:

original: rdo rje'i cho ga zhes bya ba rdo rje bzhi po bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i cho ga zhes bya ba rdo rje bzhi po bshad pa'o //
translated: The so-called vajra rite is the explanation of the four vajras.

original: dngos grub mchog gi 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos grub mchog gi 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection with the supreme power?

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: It is the connection with the creation stage.

original: rang gi lha nyid du bskyed pa'i go rims dang 'brel pa ni mig dang sku la sogs pa'i sems pa las yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha nyid du bskyed pa'i go rims dang 'brel pa ni mig dang sku la sogs pa'i sems pa las yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The connection with the sequence of creation as one's deity is the correct application from the intention of the eye, body, and so forth.

original: de gnyi ga ni dbugs dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga ni dbugs dbyung ba ste /
translated: Both of those are the exhalted states,

original: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor la yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor la yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are correctly applied to the yoga of one's deity.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni bri ba'i dkyil 'khor dang mchod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni bri ba'i dkyil 'khor dang mchod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The ‚Äúma·πá·∏çala‚Äù is the ma·πá·∏çala to be drawn and the ma·πá·∏çala of offerings.

original: brtul zhugs ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
translated: ‚ÄúVow‚Äù is the vow of knowledge.

original: slob dpon phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs su grol ba ma gtogs par slob dpon gyi bya ba gzhan dag yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang yongs su grol ba ma gtogs par slob dpon gyi bya ba gzhan dag yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfection of the master‚Äù is the other activities of the master, except for the introduction, the reassurance, and the complete liberation.

original: de ni bla ma'i sngags kyi lam gyis ni slob ma snod du rung ba rnams yongs su smin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni bla ma'i sngags kyi lam gyis ni slob ma snod du rung ba rnams yongs su smin par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the ripening of the disciples who are suitable vessels by means of the path of the guru‚Äôs mantra.

original: brtul zhugs bzang dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung ba'i brtul zhugs can gyi'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs bzang dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung ba'i brtul zhugs can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGood vow‚Äù is having the vow of correct retention.

original: slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ba gsum gyis kyang dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ba gsum gyis kyang dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpowered by the three master empowerments‚Äù is empowered by the three master empowerments.

original: rang gi slob ma ni bka' las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi slob ma ni bka' las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs disciple‚Äù is one who does not transgress the command.

original: bdag nyid che zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i de kho na nyid thams cad bstan pa la rjes su mthun pa'i dad pa dang shes rab dang bstan pa dang zab pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid che zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i de kho na nyid thams cad bstan pa la rjes su mthun pa'i dad pa dang shes rab dang bstan pa dang zab pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The great being is one who has faith, wisdom, and the profound teaching that is in accord with the teaching of the reality of the Guhyasamaja.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i shin tu gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ston pa gang yin pa de yongs su grol ba yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i shin tu gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ston pa gang yin pa de yongs su grol ba yin te /
translated: One who teaches the reality that is very secret of the Buddha and so forth is liberated,

original: dgongs pa thams cad nges par 'grel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa thams cad nges par 'grel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one explains all the intentions.

original: de la dga' ba can gyi le'u lngar ni yongs su grol ba yin la lhag ma rnams ci rigs par le'u gzhan dag la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de la dga' ba can gyi le'u lngar ni yongs su grol ba yin la lhag ma rnams ci rigs par le'u gzhan dag la sbyor ro //
translated: In the five chapters of The One with Delight, one is liberated, and the rest are applied to the other chapters as appropriate.

original: de ltar @89b na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi cha shas bzhi'i ngag bzhi gang dag yin pa ni yan lag rnam par 'thor ba phan tshun ltos pa can yin pas na gzhan gyi re re sdud par byed pa yin zhing gzhan gyi don ma lus par bsdu ba'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar @89b na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi cha shas bzhi'i ngag bzhi gang dag yin pa ni yan lag rnam par 'thor ba phan tshun ltos pa can yin pas na gzhan gyi re re sdud par byed pa yin zhing gzhan gyi don ma lus par bsdu ba'i phyir
translated: Thus, the four statements of the four parts of the root tantra are the dispersed limbs, which are mutually dependent, and so each one includes the other, and in order to include the meaning of the other without exception,

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud ni ngag gcig yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud ni ngag gcig yin no //
translated: the root tantra is one statement.

original: de gsal bar byed pa ni rgyud phyi ma ste /
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa ni rgyud phyi ma ste /
translated: The Tantra of the Subsequent Tantra is that which clarifies it.

original: de gnyi ga ni bstan pa dang bcas pa de nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga ni bstan pa dang bcas pa de nyid kyi'o //
translated: Both of them are of that very nature, along with the teaching.

original: rgyud kyi 'grel pa gnyi ga dag la yang phal cher de rjod par byed pa'i gzhung yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi 'grel pa gnyi ga dag la yang phal cher de rjod par byed pa'i gzhung yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And both of the commentaries on the Tantra are called that because they are texts that mostly express that.

original: rnal 'byor zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the question about yoga is stated:

original: thabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The union of means and wisdom, etc.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i rab tu sbyor ba rnal 'byor yin te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i rab tu sbyor ba rnal 'byor yin te /
translated: Yoga is the application of the union of means and wisdom.

original: phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the highest knowledge.

original: gang zhig ni gang yang rung ba'i shes pa dngos med pa ni rig bya dang rig pa gnyis su byar med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ni gang yang rung ba'i shes pa dngos med pa ni rig bya dang rig pa gnyis su byar med pa'o //
translated: The non-entity of any knowledge whatsoever is the non-duality of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: dngos med pa de nyid shes rab tu brjod la de nyid 'dir bye brag tu mthong bas na lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos med pa de nyid shes rab tu brjod la de nyid 'dir bye brag tu mthong bas na lhag mthong ste /
translated: That non-entity is called wisdom, and it is the insight here because it is seen in particular.

original: dga' ba'i yul yin pas dga' ma yang yin te yul dang yul can dbyer med par gyur pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yul yin pas dga' ma yang yin te yul dang yul can dbyer med par gyur pas so //
translated: It is also the beloved because it is the object of delight, since the object and the subject become inseparable.

original: shes rab nyid rig pa dang shes bya zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab nyid rig pa dang shes bya zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Wisdom itself is also called ‚Äúawareness‚Äù and ‚Äúthe object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: nye bar song ba ni thabs te sems der nye bar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar song ba ni thabs te sems der nye bar 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù is the method, the mind‚Äôs engagement with that.

original: de yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid sems de kho nar gyur pa ni phra mo nyid las mi 'phro ba sems der gyur pa kho na ste brtan zhing mi g-yo bas so //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid sems de kho nar gyur pa ni phra mo nyid las mi 'phro ba sems der gyur pa kho na ste brtan zhing mi g-yo bas so //
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of an entity is the mind itself, which is subtle, not straying from that, the mind itself, stable and unwavering.

original: de nyid ni zhi gnas te gyur pa po gud na med pa'i phyir sems nyid thabs yin la skyes bu dang ye shes kyang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhi gnas te gyur pa po gud na med pa'i phyir sems nyid thabs yin la skyes bu dang ye shes kyang yin no //
translated: That itself is ≈õamatha, because the agent of transformation is not elsewhere, the mind itself is the method, and it is also the person and gnosis.

original: rig bya dang rig pa po dang sems las byung ba dang sems de nyid dbyer med par gyur pa ni thabs dang shes rab sbyor ba ste rnam 'byor ro ;
analyzed: rig bya dang rig pa po dang sems las byung ba dang sems de nyid dbyer med par gyur pa ni thabs dang shes rab sbyor ba ste rnam 'byor ro ;
translated: The object of knowledge, the knower, the mental factors, and the mind itself become inseparable, the union of method and wisdom, the yoga.

original: / rgyud kyi dri ba zhus pa'i lan ni rgyud ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rgyud ni rgyun rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: / rgyud kyi dri ba zhus pa'i lan ni rgyud ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rgyud ni rgyun rgyas pa'o //
translated: The answer to the question about the tantra is stated in ‚ÄúThe tantra is‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on. The tantra is the continuum, the continuity, the expansion.

original: de ni rgyud de skad kyi dbyings la rgyud ni rgyas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyud de skad kyi dbyings la rgyud ni rgyas pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term tantra is used because the tantra is extended in that domain.

original: rgyun yang de yin la de yang yin pas na rgyun te de ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rab tu dbye ba las so //
analyzed: rgyun yang de yin la de yang yin pas na rgyun te de ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rab tu dbye ba las so //
translated: It is a continuum and it is also that, thus it is a continuum. It is threefold, due to classification.

original: ji ltar rab tu dbye ba las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu dbye ba las yin zhe na /
translated: How is it due to classification?üîΩIt is said:

original: gzhi dang de bzhin rang bzhin dang // spang du med pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhi dang de bzhin rang bzhin dang // spang du med pa yis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The basis, the nature, and the non-removable.

original: de las 'byung gnas rang bzhin rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de las 'byung gnas rang bzhin rgyu yin te /
translated: The source of that is the natural cause.

original: 'gro bar byed cing 'bras bu nyid thob par byed pas na rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed cing 'bras bu nyid thob par byed pas na rgyu ste /
translated: It is a cause because it causes going and it causes the attainment of the result.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of seed is the meaning of cause.

original: de ni rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That is the nature.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the primary cause.

original: @90a * // de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: @90a * // de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de 'byung gnas te thog ma'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'byung gnas te thog ma'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The source is the initial cause.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu dang po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu dang po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the first cause of enlightenment?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings 'di ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings 'di ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: This basic element, the expanse of reality, which is without beginning or end, is the mind of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin spang med 'bras bu ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir rang gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'bras bu de ni spang du med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin spang med 'bras bu ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir rang gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'bras bu de ni spang du med pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, there is no result to be eliminated, because the result of the expanse of reality, which is the natural state of things, is not to be eliminated, since all obscurations, together with their instincts, are eliminated.

original: spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa de'i tshe shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa de'i tshe shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the obscurations to be eliminated do not exist at all.

original: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The basis is called the method.

original: rang bzhin las rgyu gzhan ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin las rgyu gzhan ni thabs yin no //
translated: The cause, which is other than the nature, is the method.

original: de ni gzhi yin te de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhi yin te de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the basis, because the yogin who is established in that attains the result.

original: gsum gyis rgyud kyi don bsdus te /
analyzed: gsum gyis rgyud kyi don bsdus te /
translated: The meaning of the tantra is summarized in three ways.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu thabs kyi rgyud gsum nyid kyis rgyud kyi don ma lus par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu thabs kyi rgyud gsum nyid kyis rgyud kyi don ma lus par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the tantra is summarized in its entirety in the three tantras of cause, result, and method.

original: thabs ni sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir thabs kyi rgyud du rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thabs ni sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir thabs kyi rgyud du rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since the method is divided into mantra, mudra, and so on, is it not logical that it is a tantra of method?

original: rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings nyid yin la de yang gcig nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings nyid yin la de yang gcig nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The cause is the dharmadhatu itself, and that is one.üîΩSince there is no continuum, it is not logical that it is a tantra of cause.

original: rgyun med pa'i phyir rgyu'i rgyud rigs pa ma yin la de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i rgyud kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun med pa'i phyir rgyu'i rgyud rigs pa ma yin la de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i rgyud kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since that is so, it is also not logical that it is a tantra of result.

original: 'dir rigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rigs kyi sgra ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la rigs kyi sgra ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äútantra‚Äù is applied to all, as stated in the following:

original: rigs dang rus dang rgyud dang sa bon dang rgyud dang khams dang bla ma dang thog ma dang 'byung gnas dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang rgyud dang sa bon dang rgyud dang khams dang bla ma dang thog ma dang 'byung gnas dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTantra,‚Äù ‚Äúfamily,‚Äù ‚Äúlineage,‚Äù ‚Äúseed,‚Äù ‚Äúcontinuum,‚Äù ‚Äúelement,‚Äù ‚Äúguru,‚Äù ‚Äúbeginning,‚Äù ‚Äúsource,‚Äù and ‚Äúnature‚Äù are synonyms.

original: rigs lnga ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog ces bya ba rigs lnga po dag go //
analyzed: rigs lnga ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog ces bya ba rigs lnga po dag go //
translated: The five families are the five families of delusion, hatred, pride, desire, and jealousy.

original: rigs gsum dag ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba rigs gsum po dag go //
analyzed: rigs gsum dag ni gti mug dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba rigs gsum po dag go //
translated: The three lineages are called the lineages of delusion, hatred, and desire.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig rigs ni rang bzhin ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin ro gcig tu 'jug pa de ni rigs gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig rigs ni rang bzhin ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin ro gcig tu 'jug pa de ni rigs gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The single nature is the lineage of the nature, which is the single taste of the nature. That is the meaning of the single lineage.

original: rigs brgya zhes bya ba ni rigs mtha' yas pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs brgya zhes bya ba ni rigs mtha' yas pa yin te /
translated: The hundred lineages are the infinite lineages,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni re re zhing rab tu mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni re re zhing rab tu mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because each of the qualities of a buddha is infinite.

original: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa de ni zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbyang chub rdo rje ni rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa na byang chub kyang de yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa de ni zhes gsungs pa'o // byang chub rdo rje ni rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa na byang chub kyang de yin la /
translated: The statement of the division of the lineages is as follows.üîΩEnlightenment-vajra is the ultimate purity, and it is enlightenment because it is the nature of the mind of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje yang yin pas na byang chub dro rje ste de nyid ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje yang yin pas na byang chub dro rje ste de nyid ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Therefore, it is the vajra of enlightenment. That is the dharmadhatu.

original: de ni khyad @90b par de dang bcas par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni khyad @90b par de dang bcas par gsungs pa ste /
translated: That is stated with that distinction.

original: rigs lnga la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: are taught.

original: de'i phyir yang de ni bla ma'i rgyud du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ni bla ma'i rgyud du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is also accepted as the Utterance of the Guru.

original: de'i khyad par de dag bcas par gsungs pa de ni rgyu'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud bla ma ste rgyu'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i khyad par de dag bcas par gsungs pa de ni rgyu'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud bla ma ste rgyu'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it teaches the special qualities of that, it is the Utterance of the Guru, because it has the nature of the stream of the cause. The meaning of the word is the Utterance of the Cause.

original: de skad du yang dpal mchog dang po la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal mchog dang po la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Shri-Paramodaya, etc., it is said:

original: rgyud ni rgyun zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: The stream is explained as the Utterance.

original: bla ma nyid ni thog mar brjod //
analyzed: bla ma nyid ni thog mar brjod //
translated: The Guru is first mentioned.

original: de nyid gsang ba gsang chen ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsang ba gsang chen ni //
translated: That very secret, the great secret,

original: bla ma'i rgyud ni yin par 'dod //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: bla ma'i rgyud ni yin par 'dod // ces gsungs so //
translated: is accepted as the Utterance of the Guru.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i rigs gcig la nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs gcig la rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i rigs gcig la nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs gcig la rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: Just as the one lineage of the Aryas is made threefold by the divisions of the Sravakas, etc., so the one lineage of the Bodhisattvas is made fivefold, etc. by the divisions of the five families, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because there is no division in the Dharmadhatu,

original: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //üîΩbrten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin // brten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
translated: The families are not definitely fixed.üîΩThe divisions of the families

original: de yi dbye ba rab tu brjod //üîΩces gsungs so ;
analyzed: de yi dbye ba rab tu brjod // ces gsungs so ;
translated: are declared according to the distinctions of the supported doctrine.

original: / gti mug gtso bor gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i rigs ni gti mug gi rigs so //
analyzed: / gti mug gtso bor gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i rigs ni gti mug gi rigs so //
translated: The family of the bodhisattva whose principal element is delusion is the family of delusion.

original: zhe sdang gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi ni zhe sdang gi rigs te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyi ni zhe sdang gi rigs te /
translated: The family of the bodhisattva whose principal element is hatred is the family of hatred.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: rgyu'i rgyud nyid rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa yang 'bras bu'i rgyud yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud nyid rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa yang 'bras bu'i rgyud yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not unreasonable to say that the causal continuum itself, at the stage of its culmination in purification, is the resultant continuum.

original: rgyud kyi don zhus nas rgyu'i rgyud kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: rgyud kyi don zhus nas rgyu'i rgyud kyang gsungs la /
translated: Having asked about the meaning of continuum, he also asks about the causal continuum.

original: de yang rigs lnga la sogs pa yin no zhes nges par mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa nyis kyi de kho na nyid ni rnam pa du /üîΩrigs kyi gsang ba ni rnam pa du /
analyzed: de yang rigs lnga la sogs pa yin no zhes nges par mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa nyis kyi de kho na nyid ni rnam pa du / rigs kyi gsang ba ni rnam pa du /
translated: Having determined that the causal continuum is the five families, etc., he asks about the reality of the families, the secrets of the families, and the great secrets of the families.üîΩHow many kinds of reality are there?üîΩHow many kinds of secrets of the families are there?

original: rigs kyi gsang chen ni gang lags /
analyzed: rigs kyi gsang chen ni gang lags /
translated: What is the great secret of the families?

original: rigs kyi dam pa ni rnam pa du zhig mchis zhes 'dri ba'i zhu ba bzhi bo byas pa de la de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi dam pa ni rnam pa du zhig mchis zhes 'dri ba'i zhu ba bzhi bo byas pa de la de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reply to that is: ‚ÄúThat itself, etc. ‚Äù

original: de nyid rnam pa lnga gang yin pa de rgyud thams cad kyis bsdus pa phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa lnga gang yin pa de rgyud thams cad kyis bsdus pa phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself, which is fivefold, is subtle because it is included in all tantras.

original: gsang ba rnam gsum ni de shin tu phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba rnam gsum ni de shin tu phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three secrets are very subtle.

original: lha rnams kyi bdag po lhag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi bdag po lhag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Lord of gods, the supreme god, is the BhagavƒÅn.

original: de ni gsang chen te shin tu rab tu phra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsang chen te shin tu rab tu phra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is the great secret, because it is extremely subtle.

original: rigs rnam pa brgya ni rigs kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs rnam pa brgya ni rigs kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The hundred kinds of lineages are the various natures of the lineages.

original: de ni dam pa ste mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dam pa ste mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is the supreme, because it is infinite.

original: de de ltar na dri ba'i zhu ba dgu po dang lan gyi @91a * //
analyzed: de de ltar na dri ba'i zhu ba dgu po dang lan gyi @91a * //
translated: Thus, the nine questions and the replies

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i spyi'i don yang dag par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i spyi'i don yang dag par phye ba yin no //
translated: are the general meaning of the GuhyasamƒÅja Yoga Tantra.

original: gzhung gzhan ni yan lag gi don ji ltar sbas pa rnams rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhung gzhan ni yan lag gi don ji ltar sbas pa rnams rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other texts are for the purpose of fully distinguishing the hidden meanings of the branches.

original: de la dang por le'u dang po la sbas pa'i tshig gi don rnams zhus pa ni /üîΩbyang chub sems zhes ci la bgyi //
analyzed: de la dang por le'u dang po la sbas pa'i tshig gi don rnams zhus pa ni / byang chub sems zhes ci la bgyi //
translated: Therein, first, the hidden meanings of the words in the first chapter are asked about,

original: zhes bya ba la brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la brtsams te /
translated: beginning with ‚ÄúWhat is called the thought of awakening?‚Äù

original: de bzhin bighan'anta kri ta ci zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bighan'anta kri ta ci zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: and ending with ‚ÄúWhat is called the difficult to conquer?‚Äù

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi don ni thog ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi don ni thog ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therein, the meaning of the thought of awakening is stated with ‚ÄúWithout beginning or end,‚Äù and so on.

original: thog ma ni skye ba yin la tha ma ni 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma ni skye ba yin la tha ma ni 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The beginning is birth and the end is destruction.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: Because they do not exist, it is without beginning or end.

original: chos kyi dbyings sems kyi rang bzhin yin la de nyid ni byang chub kyi sems yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sems kyi rang bzhin yin la de nyid ni byang chub kyi sems yin no //
translated: The basic element of phenomena is the nature of mind, and that itself is the thought of awakening.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang gi don gyis na thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje 'chang gi don gyis na thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the meaning of Vajradhara, it is without beginning or end.

original: sems la ma gtogs pa'i don du rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad kyi don gyis na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sems la ma gtogs pa'i don du rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad kyi don gyis na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace, in the sense of Vairocana, because all conceptual thoughts are completely pacified, except for the mind.

original: chos dang chos nyid kyi rgyu mtshan rnams nub pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i don gyis dngos dang dngos min zad pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid kyi rgyu mtshan rnams nub pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i don gyis dngos dang dngos min zad pa'o //
translated: It is the exhaustion of entity and non-entity, in the sense of Ak·π£obhya, because the signs of phenomena and reality have subsided.

original: chos kyi dbyings tsam gyi bdag nyid dang sangs rgyas thams cad dbyer med par mthong ba'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan gyi don gyis na khyab bdag ste thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings tsam gyi bdag nyid dang sangs rgyas thams cad dbyer med par mthong ba'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan gyi don gyis na khyab bdag ste thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is the all-pervading lord, in the sense of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, because it is the nature of the mere expanse of reality and is seen as inseparable from all buddhas.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la dga' ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa'i don gyis na stong pa nyid mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la dga' ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa'i don gyis na stong pa nyid mi phyed pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible emptiness, in the sense of AmitƒÅbha, because it is the complete determination of emptiness in every way for those who delight in the basis of characteristics and characteristics.

original: sna tshogs kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir don yod par grub pa'i don gyis na snying rje mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir don yod par grub pa'i don gyis na snying rje mi phyed pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible compassion, in the sense of Amoghasiddhi, because it performs various benefits.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi don 'di yang le'u dang por sangs rgyas lnga rnams chos nyid dang lhan cig thugs kar zhugs pa dang de zhu ba dang dkyil 'khor du zhu ba dang / longs spyod pa po dang / longs spyod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi don 'di yang le'u dang por sangs rgyas lnga rnams chos nyid dang lhan cig thugs kar zhugs pa dang de zhu ba dang dkyil 'khor du zhu ba dang / longs spyod pa po dang / longs spyod par bya ba dang /
translated: This meaning of the Thought of Enlightenment should be understood as follows: In the first chapter, the five Buddhas enter into the reality along with the mind, and that melting, and the melting in the mandala, and the enjoyer, and the enjoyed, and

original: longs spyod zhu ba dang 'od zer spros pas sna tshogs dbang bskur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod zhu ba dang 'od zer spros pas sna tshogs dbang bskur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: the melting of the enjoyment, and the emission of light rays, and the various initiations.

original: byang chub kyi sems de nyid las rig pa'i skyes bu 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de nyid las rig pa'i skyes bu 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the Person of Awareness arises from that very Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de zhus pa'i de ma thag tu lan sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhus pa'i de ma thag tu lan sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that question, the answer is stated, ‚ÄúThe Body, etc.‚Äù

original: tshigs bcad phyed phyi mas ni nges tshig bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed phyi mas ni nges tshig bstan te /
translated: The latter half of the verse teaches the derivation of the term.

original: lhan cig ces pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ces pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù is the third.

original: rig par ldan pa zhes pa @91b ni don gyis na skyes bu la bya'o //
analyzed: rig par ldan pa zhes pa @91b ni don gyis na skyes bu la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with Awareness‚Äù is to be understood by implication as referring to the Person.

original: rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i skyes bu ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i skyes bu ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: The Person who is together with Awareness is the Person of Awareness.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa'o //
translated: The middle word is elided.

original: phyed snga ma ni 'di'i rig pa ste /
analyzed: phyed snga ma ni 'di'i rig pa ste /

original: mi phyed pa ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems su thams cad zhu bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni 'dir byang chub kyi sems su thams cad zhu bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the indivisible is that which is all melted into the enlightenment spirit here.

original: gang gis mi phyed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis mi phyed ce na /
translated: By what is it indivisible?

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yis te /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yis te /

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid do //

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsungs thugs dang de bzhin nyid ces zlas phye la zhu bar mi phyed pa'o zhes bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsungs thugs dang de bzhin nyid ces zlas phye la zhu bar mi phyed pa'o zhes bsdu ba'o //
translated: The analysis of the Buddha‚Äôs body, speech, and mind and of thusness is indivisible in the melting.

original: phye ba'i ngo bos zhes pa ni de dag nyid phye ba'i rigs pas rig pa dang skyes bur phye bas te /
analyzed: phye ba'i ngo bos zhes pa ni de dag nyid phye ba'i rigs pas rig pa dang skyes bur phye bas te /
translated: The analysis of the nature is by the analysis of those very things by the reasoning of analysis into knowledge and person.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis de bzhin nyid ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis de bzhin nyid ni rig pa ste /

original: de yang rig bya'i cha'o //
analyzed: de yang rig bya'i cha'o //

original: rig pa po'i cha ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: rig pa po'i cha ni skyes bu'o //

original: de sku gsungs thugs phye ba las ni gnyi ga'i zhal gsum mo //
analyzed: de sku gsungs thugs phye ba las ni gnyi ga'i zhal gsum mo //

original: mi phyed par ni don dam par te des na de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed par ni don dam par te des na de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Indivisibly is ultimately, and thus it is endowed with that.

original: rig pa'i skyes bu de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes bu de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor phyung ba yin no //
translated: The person of knowledge himself has extracted the mandala.

original: de la sngags bcu gsum dang rigs lnga btsun mo'i phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sdom pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'dri ba'i zhu ba nyi shu rtsa drug byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sngags bcu gsum dang rigs lnga btsun mo'i phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i sdom pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'dri ba'i zhu ba nyi shu rtsa drug byas pa yin no //
translated: With respect to that, having taken up the two vows called the thirteen mantras and the perfection of the five families' queens, the twenty-six questions are asked.

analyzed: de la ci zhes bya ba'i sgra bco lnga ni 'dri ba bco lnga dang / rigs 'dir de bzhin gang zhig lags //

original: zhes bya ba gcig nyid kyis bcu gcig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gcig nyid kyis bcu gcig go //

original: rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa la gang zhig lags zhes pa ni thun mong du sgra gcig yin gyi bye brag tu na bcu gcig go //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa la gang zhig lags zhes pa ni thun mong du sgra gcig yin gyi bye brag tu na bcu gcig go //

original: don gyi rigs ni ci /
analyzed: don gyi rigs ni ci /

analyzed: zhe sdang ni gang /

analyzed: 'dod chags ni gang /

analyzed: 'dod pa ni gang zhes bya ba 'di yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa ni de dag dang 'dra bar dkyil 'khor pa gzhan dag gi ming ji lta bu zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: de la dang por zhus pa'i badzra dhrik gi sngags kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: Therein, first, the meaning of the mantra ‚Äúvajra-dh·πõk‚Äù is stated.

original: zhi gnas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas so //
translated: ≈öamatha.

original: rig bya ni lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: rig bya ni lhag mthong ste /
translated: The object of knowledge is vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: That also is fivefold.

original: bcu po de dag @92a * //
analyzed: bcu po de dag @92a * //
translated: Those ten

original: gcig tu gyur pa ni rdo rje zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa ni rdo rje zhes bshad do //

original: de nyid mchog tu brtan pa'i phyir dang mchog tu phra ba'i bsam gtan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid mchog tu brtan pa'i phyir dang mchog tu phra ba'i bsam gtan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //

original: de nyid 'dzin pa ste byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa'i phyir dhrik ces bshad de /

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /

analyzed: yid ces bya ba smos te rnam par shes pa'o //

original: dzi na dzik gi sngags kyi don gsungs pa yod dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lus zhes bya ba ni sngar thal ba'i yid ces bya ba dang sbyar te /

analyzed: sems can kun zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi lha thams cad do //

original: yang de ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ci zhe na /

analyzed: gdan rnam pa lnga la gnas pa'i sngags rnam pa lnga'o //

analyzed: ci 'dra zhig ce na /

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa las byung ste /

analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni rdo rje'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: rdo rje'i sgo las padma'i nang du gdan dang bcas pa'i sna tshogs pa las byung ba'i der chud pa rnams so //

original: de lta bu'i yid ni dzik ste /

original: a'a ro lik go //
